column4: I also had a question about eth0. I have no clue what it is. eth1 is my gigabit NIC, and eth2 is my 10/100 NIC, but eth0 is just there...
there won't be eth0 there without a real interface - maybe lspci will show it?
I think its my onboard, but I thought I disabled that...
well apparently not
Never mind... I redid my bios, forgot to turn that off. I wonder if turning it off would fix my other problem.
Did you get my other question?
My other interfaces will not go up automatically. I have to manually ifup them... After a new install I have to add them to my /etc/networking/interfaces config in order to use them.
well if interfaces is correct after the upgrade, where's the problem?
I have my /etc/network/interfaces set up, but I still have to manually ifup them
you probly need 'auto eth1' or similiar in there
I might be missing something in my config
That just hit me too... That is what I was thinking of. :P
All this time and until I actually think about my config do I actually realize what the problem is.
Well thanks, even though it hit me right before you answered, without you I dought I would have actually thought about it. :) Thanks for the help.
It is also possible to change the name of the interfaces. For example... From eth2 to eth1 and eth2 to eth1.. Do you know how to do this? I have done it once, but forgot what I did.
/etc/iftab
The file doesn't exist. Do I have to create it? If so I will just look up the format.
man iftab
Thanks
No man for it.
I just looked it up on google. I will read that.
